pr_title: SearchableSnapshotDirectory should not evict cache files when closed

timeline.message: Use listeners to manage cache files associated with removed shards

timeline.bodyText: Would holding the readLock not be enough?
timeline.author: henningandersen

replies.bodyText: It is enough, I'm not sure why I used and documented the usage of the write lock here. I pushed 082e0c8 to use the read lock instead (as it should prevent any mutation anyway)
replies.author: tlrx

timeline.bodyText:
I am not sure this is necessary. When cache.invalidate fails, it already removed the object from the map, so if we retry an eviction, it will not hit the shard anyway.
So if we can remove this, I think we can also drop the shardsEvictionLock, which makes markShardAsEvictedInCache safer wrt. being called from the cluster applier thread.
timeline.author: henningandersen

replies.bodyText: I think you are right, I pushed 393deaf to remove the usage of the lock here (but such locks are still necessary to avoid cache files eviction while starting the directory). Let me know what you think.
replies.author: tlrx

replies.bodyText:
I think the locks could be removed with some restructure, but we can tackle that in a follow-up, it is not really important.
However, if we add to evictedShards here while running the job on the thread, I think we risk it leaking since nothing will remove it later? I think we should assert success here. AFAICS, there is no way this should fail unless there is a bug somewhere.
replies.author: henningandersen

replies.bodyText:
I will be happy to know more about how you think it could be restructured. For now I'm taking this point and will come back to you in a short future for tackling this.
I agree there's a risk of leaking a ShardEviction around but I think it is very unlikely to happen. One idea would be to hook into the cache sync task to clean up any left overs ShardEviction there. If that's OK we can address this too as a follow up with the previous point. For now I added the success assertion.
replies.author: tlrx

replies.bodyText: I've opened #67160 which should improve the situation.
replies.author: tlrx

timeline.bodyText: Perhaps we need to catch exception here and assert that they are io-related, write a warning and then continue with the next file? That ensures we remove all cache files from the cache in one go, but may linger some files if there are io-issues.
timeline.author: henningandersen

replies.bodyText: Yes, your suggestion makes eviction safer - just in case. I pushed 58b7bd9
replies.author: tlrx

timeline.author: henningandersen

timeline.bodyText: Can we just catch RuntimeException instead, since invalidate declares to not throw checked?
timeline.author: henningandersen

timeline.bodyText: Looking closer at this, I suppose this should never happen since we catch IO exceptions in onCacheFileRemoval, so we could just assert false : e here instead?
timeline.author: henningandersen

timeline.bodyText: I think we could also assert false : e here?
timeline.author: henningandersen
